00060 using std::cerr;
00061 using std::endl;
00062 
00070 Int32::Int32(const string &n) 
00071     : BaseType(n, dods_int32_c, (xdrproc_t)XDR_INT32)
00072 {
00073 }
00074 
00075 Int32::Int32(const Int32 &copy_from) : BaseType(copy_from)
00076 {
00077     _buf = copy_from._buf;
00078 }
00079     
00080 BaseType *
00081 Int32::ptr_duplicate()
00082 {
00083     return new Int32(*this);
00084 }
00085 
00086 Int32::~Int32()
00087 {
00088     DBG(cerr << "~Int32" << endl);
00089 }
00090 
00091 Int32 &
00092 Int32::operator=(const Int32 &rhs)
00093 {
00094     if (this == &rhs)
00095     return *this;
00096 
00097     dynamic_cast<BaseType &>(*this) = rhs;
00098 
00099     _buf = rhs._buf;
00100 
00101     return *this;
00102 }
00103 
00104 unsigned int
00105 Int32::width()
00106 {
00107     return sizeof(dods_int32);
00108 }
00109 
00110 bool
00111 Int32::serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00112          bool ce_eval)
00113 {
00114     dds.timeout_on();
00115 
00116     if (!read_p())
00117     read(dataset);      // read() throws Error and InternalErr
00118 
00119     if (ce_eval && !dds.eval_selection(dataset))
00120     return true;
00121   
00122     dds.timeout_off();
00123 
00124     if (!XDR_INT32(sink, &_buf))
00125     throw Error(
00126 "Network I/O Error. Culd not read int 32 data.\n\
00127 This may be due to a bug in DODS, on the server or a\n\
00128 problem with the network connection.");
00129   
00130     return true;
00131 }
00132 
00133 bool
00134 Int32::deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *, bool)
00135 {
00136     if (!XDR_INT32(source, &_buf))
00137     throw Error(
00138 "Network I/O Error. Could not send int 32 data. This may be due to a\n\
00139 bug in DODS or a problem with the network connection.");
00140 
00141     return false;
00142 }
00143 
00144 unsigned int
00145 Int32::val2buf(void *val, bool)
00146 {
00147   // Jose Garcia
00148   // This method is public therefore and I believe it has being designed
00149   // to be use by read which must be implemented on the surrogated library,
00150   // thus if the pointer val is NULL, is an Internal Error. 
00151   if(!val)
00152       throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, 
00153             "The incoming pointer does not contain any data.");
00154   
00155   _buf = *(dods_int32 *)val;
00156   
00157   return width();
00158 }
00159 
00160 unsigned int
00161 Int32::buf2val(void **val)
00162 {
00163   // Jose Garcia
00164   // The same comment justifying throwing an Error in val2buf applies here.
00165   if (!val)
00166       throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "NULL pointer.");
00167   
00168   if (!*val)
00169     *val = new dods_int32;
00170   
00171   *(dods_int32 *)*val =_buf;
00172   
00173   return width();
00174 }
00175 
00176 // Print BUF to stdout with its declaration. Intended mostly for debugging.
00177 
00178 void 
00179 Int32::print_val(ostream &os, string space, bool print_decl_p)
00180 {
00181     if (print_decl_p) {
00182     print_decl(os, space, false);
00183     os << " = " << _buf << ";" << endl;
00184     }
00185     else 
00186     os << _buf;
00187 }
00188 
00189 void 
00190 Int32::print_val(FILE *out, string space, bool print_decl_p)
00191 {
00192     if (print_decl_p) {
00193     print_decl(out, space, false);
00194     fprintf( out, " = %d;\n", (int)_buf ) ;
00195     }
00196     else 
00197     fprintf( out, "%d", (int)_buf ) ;
00198 }
00199 
00200 bool
00201 Int32::ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset)
00202 {
00203 
00204     // Extract the Byte arg's value.
00205     if (!read_p() && !read(dataset)) {
00206       // Jose Garcia
00207       // Since the read method is virtual and implemented outside
00208       // libdap++ if we can not read the data that is the problem 
00209       // of the user or of whoever wrote the surrogate library
00210       // implemeting read therefore it is an internal error.
00211       throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "This value not read!");
00212     }
00213     
00214     // Extract the second arg's value.
00215     if (!b->read_p() && !b->read(dataset)) {
00216       // Jose Garcia
00217       // Since the read method is virtual and implemented outside
00218       // libdap++ if we can not read the data that is the problem 
00219       // of the user or of whoever wrote the surrogate library
00220       // implemeting read therefore it is an internal error.
00221       throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "This value not read!");
00222     }
00223     
00224     switch (b->type()) {
00225       case dods_byte_c:
00226     return rops<dods_int32, dods_byte, SUCmp<dods_int32, dods_byte> >
00227         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Byte *>(b)->_buf, op);
00228       case dods_int16_c:
00229     return rops<dods_int32, dods_int16, Cmp<dods_int32, dods_int16> >
00230         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Int16 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00231       case dods_uint16_c:
00232     return rops<dods_int32, dods_uint16, SUCmp<dods_int32, dods_uint16> >
00233         (_buf, dynamic_cast<UInt16 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00234       case dods_int32_c:
00235     return rops<dods_int32, dods_int32, Cmp<dods_int32, dods_int32> >
00236         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Int32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00237       case dods_uint32_c:
00238     return rops<dods_int32, dods_uint32, SUCmp<dods_int32, dods_uint32> >
00239         (_buf, dynamic_cast<UInt32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00240       case dods_float32_c:
00241     return rops<dods_int32, dods_float32, Cmp<dods_int32, dods_float32> >
00242         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Float32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00243       case dods_float64_c:
00244     return rops<dods_int32, dods_float64, Cmp<dods_int32, dods_float64> >
00245         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Float64 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00246       default:
00247     return false;
00248     }
00249 }

00310 // Revision 1.40.4.4  2001/10/02 17:01:52  jimg

00312 // use Error exceptions to signal problems with network I/O and InternalErr
00313 // exceptions to signal other problems. The return codes, always true for
00314 // serialize and always false for deserialize, are now meaningless. However,
00315 // by always returning a code that means OK, old code should continue to work.

00317 // Revision 1.43  2001/09/28 17:50:07  jimg
00318 // Merged with 3.2.7.
00319 //
00320 // Revision 1.40.4.3  2001/09/07 00:38:35  jimg
00321 // Sequence::deserialize(...) now reads all the sequence values at once.
00322 // Its call semantics are the same as the other classes' versions. Values
00323 // are stored in the Sequence object using a vector<BaseType *> for each
00324 // row (those are themselves held in a vector). Three new accessor methods
00325 // have been added to Sequence (row_value() and two versions of var_value()).
00326 // BaseType::deserialize(...) now always returns true. This matches with the
00327 // expectations of most client code (the seqeunce version returned false
00328 // when it was done reading, but all the calls for sequences must be changed
00329 // anyway). If an XDR error is found, deserialize throws InternalErr.
00330 //

00356 // Revision 1.38  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00357 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00358 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00359 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00360 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00361 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00362 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00493 // Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:34:46  jimg
00494 // Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00495 // Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00496 // contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00497 // Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00498 // class represenation.
00499 // Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00500 // types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00501 // an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00502 // Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00503 // objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00504 // C would store them.
00505 // Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00506 // an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00507 // objects).
00508 //

00511 // Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.

00513 // will be removed in a future release.
00514 // Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00515 // internal buffer.
00516 // Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00517 // Fixed read_val().
00518 // Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00519 // cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
